decision_conditions: 1.  The consent shall expire after 5 years from the date of this notice.

2.  Any advertisements displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
3.  Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition.
4.  Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
5.  No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

6.  No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters) or aerodrome (civil or military).

Note: These are imposed automatically unless expressly varied, for instance the time limit shortened. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and plans: Site Location Plan (Dwg no. 5053-0103 - Rev P02); Elevations as Existing 01 of 02 (Dwg no. 5053-0400 - Rev P03); Elevations as Existing 02 of 02 (Dwg no. 5053-0406 - Rev P01); Signage Location Plan (Dwg no. 5053-1000 - Rev P01); Proposed Signage Details 01 (Dwg no. 6073-1001 - Rev P01); Proposed Signage Details 02 (Dwg no. 6073-1002 - Rev P01); Planning statement MM/KN0035/20 prepared by Walsingham Planning dated 07.08.2024.

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The illumination of the sign(s)/advertisement(s) shall comply with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Professionals in their Guidance Document PLG 05/23 the Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements including Digital Displays, 2023 (or its equivalent in a replacement guide), including the following operational features:
-	Maximum level of illuminance to be set to night-time and daytime levels in accordance with Institution of Lighting Professionals Guidelines
-	Static images to be displayed only (no moving or flashing images).

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by artificial lighting, in accordance with Policy D3, D4, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Installation of internally illuminated 2no. fascia signs and 2no. billboard displays (following removal of existing signage) (Advertisement Consent)
